meanings.definition: To move or progress rapidly or aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah was highballing across the savanna, chasing its prey.
meanings.sent2: The train was highballing down the tracks, reaching top speed in no time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was highballing through the trees, trying to gather as many nuts as possible.
meanings.sent4: The athlete was highballing towards the finish line, determined to win the race.
meanings.sent5: The car was highballing through the winding roads, making sharp turns effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To estimate or quote a price or value at a high level.
meanings.sent1: The salesman was highballing the cost of the car, hoping to make a big profit.
meanings.sent2: The contractor was highballing the renovation project, expecting it to be more expensive than usual.
meanings.sent3: The student was highballing the price of the textbook, joking that it must be made of gold.
meanings.sent4: The auctioneer was highballing the value of the painting, trying to attract more bidders.
meanings.sent5: The real estate agent was highballing the house price, aiming to get a high commission.

meanings.definition: A type of mixed drink typically made with alcohol and a carbonated beverage.
meanings.sent1: At the party, they served highballing drinks with a splash of soda and whiskey.
meanings.sent2: The bartender mixed a highballing cocktail with gin and tonic for the customer.
meanings.sent3: The highballing drink was so fizzy that it tickled my nose when I took a sip.
meanings.sent4: The highballing beverage looked like a sparkling gem in the dimly lit bar.
meanings.sent5: The highballing cocktail was the perfect refreshment on a hot summer day.
